result.execSummary:
The defendant Cher Vue was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: GFE to obtain/maintain full time employment, schooling or combination of both.  If not, complete 10 job applications per month.
Shall not possess any dangerous weapons

Participate in counseling as deemed appropriate by agent.  

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

timeConds.notes: with huber for work, treatment and counseling.

Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Clerk: Britney 
Case Called: 10:58 a.m. 
State appears by ADA Desiree Toldt. Defendant appears in custody with Attorney Wright Laufenberg. Date & time set for Final Pre-trial. Parties have reached an agreement and proceed with Plea Hearing.
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights & Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief filed.  VRCW.
State moves to DRI Ct.2- Disorderly Conduct (Domestic Abuse) (Use of a Dangerous Weapon)
COURT GRANTS. 
PLEA: Ct.1- 2nd- Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety (Domestic Abuse)>>NO CONTEST 
COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made: a factual basis & def guilty. 
COURT ORDERS: SWH- 3 years probation. CONDITIONS: 12 months MCJ with huber for work, treatment and counseling with 242 days credit, participate in counseling as deemed appropriate by agent, shall not possess any dangerous weapons, maintain absolute sobriety, AODA and follow up, GFE obtain/maintain FTE, schooling or a combination of both, and if not, complete 10 job applications per month, CC & DNA surcharge.

Absolute sobriety.  No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores or Beer Tents.   No contact with victim(s):  C.V.   Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.    Defendant shall not possess any dangerous weapons during the pendency of this action.
